entry.title: FIRE SEASON ENDS ACROSS ODF SOUTHWEST OREGON DISTRICT
entry.summary: October 16, 2023 4:00 a.m. After 134 days, the Oregon Department of Forestry Southwest Oregon District declared an end to the 2023 fire season in Josephine and Jackson counties on Friday. Public Information Officer Natalie Weber said consistent rain across the district and new, green grass and vegetation growing in has allowed for all fire...

entry.title: WORK UNDERWAY TO WIDEN FREEWAY OFF-RAMP AT GARDEN VALLEY
entry.summary: October 16, 2023 3:50 a.m. Work is underway to widen the freeway off-ramp from northbound Interstate 5 to Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard in Roseburg. Dan Latham from the Oregon Department of Transportation said traffic congestion is a frequent problem on that off-ramp. Latham said the ramp provides a left-turn lane onto Garden Valley Boulevard and...

entry.title: JUDICIAL DEPARTMENT WITH ONLINE COMMUNITY CONVERSATION

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY GOP HAS TRUMP-REAGAN DINNER AND FUNDRAISER
entry.summary: October 16, 2023 3:20 a.m. The Douglas County GOP is having the Trump-Reagan dinner and fundraiser on Saturday October 28th at the Roseburg Country Club. Nationally known speaker and author William J. Federer will headline the evening. The event includes a live auction, raffles and a wine pull. Tickets are available from $30 with dinner...

entry.title: FLY TYING & CASTING FESTIVAL IS SATURDAY
entry.summary: October 16, 2023 3:00 a.m. Fly Fishing Veterans and Umpqua Valley Fly Fishers will have the 2023 Umpqua Fly Tying & Casting Festival this Saturday at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. entry.title: Former inmate Kyle Hedquist works to support prison reform after release

entry.title: Forest Bridges invites public to second meeting on active conservation management plan
entry.summary: Douglas County residents interested in contributing to a forest conservation management plan are encouraged to join Forest Bridges representatives at the Roseburg Public Library on Wednesday.

entry.title: Roseburg councilor on list of Governor’s appointments

entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Forest Bridges will hold its second in a series of public meetings from 7-8:30 p.m. Wednesday at the Roseburg Public Library, 1409 NE Diamond Lake Blvd., Roseburg.

entry.title: Green Valley Pumpkin Patch: launching gourds and sipping cider
entry.summary: OAKLAND — Nothing says fall like picking a plump orange pumpkin, bouncing on hayrides and sipping fresh apple cider — all of which can be found at the Green Valley Pumpkin Patch.

entry.title: Roseburg library has amazing friends
entry.summary: We celebrate the Friends of the Roseburg Public Library every day but especially during National Friends of Libraries Week Sunday through Oct. 21.

entry.title: Walk, Bike & Roll event encourages healthy approaches to school transportation
entry.summary: GREEN — Nearly 300 children gathered at the shopping center in Green on Friday morning to take part in a Walk, Bike and Roll event to encourage safe, healthy activity for students.

entry.title: Idaho man dies in crash Wednesday
entry.summary: GLIDE — Douglas Floyd, 70, of Middleton, Idaho, died Wednesday in a single vehicle crash on Highway 138E, near milepost 21, east of Glide.

entry.title: Jim Baird appointed to Water Professionals International Board
entry.summary: Jim Baird, general manager for the Roseburg Urban Sanitary Authority, was appointed as the Water Environment Federation representative to the Water Professionals International Board of Directors in September.

entry.title: Wildlife Safari fosters cheetah cub
entry.summary: WINSTON — Wildlife Safari announced it has successfully integrated a cheetah cub into a new family. This act marks a milestone for conservation efforts worldwide.

entry.title: SAIF RETURNS MORE THAN $3.3 MILLION TO DOUGLAS COUNTY ECONOMY
entry.summary: October 13, 2023 3:40 a.m. SAIF recently announced a $135 million dividend for more than 52,000 employers statewide. A release said checks are going out this week. entry.title: Glide students paint parking spaces, hold contest
entry.summary: GLIDE — The sun was shining, paint cans and brushes lay haphazardly around the parking lot and the air smelled like paint and burgers as teachers held conferences inside and seniors splattered paint outside.

entry.title: German exchange students visit Roseburg
entry.summary: From wearing pajamas to school, seeing more fast-food restaurants than previously imaginable and attending an American football game, Oregon high school life is an interesting journey for 10 exchange students to explore.
